abstract: Talking points from a public relations firm offered a glowing picture of the future. Others, inside and outside the government, disagreed.
snippet: Talking points from a public relations firm offered a glowing picture of the future. Others, inside and outside the government, disagreed.
lead_paragraph: The Solyndra e-mails that House Democrats used to write the memo they released on Monday, in an effort to refute the idea that political favoritism was in play, are now posted on their Energy and Commerce Web site, and they have a few more nuggets about the company.
